description: {"blocks":[{"key":"vten","text":"Autosomal recessive mutations in PTEN-induced kinase 1 (PINK1) are associated with early-onset Parkinson's disease (PD) [1]. Upon inducing mitochondrial depolarization using uncouplers, the full-length human PINK1 stabilizes at mitochondria with the TOM (translocase of the outer mitochondrial membrane) complex, undergoing autophosphorylation and activation [2]. PINK1 plays a crucial role in phosphorylating ubiquitin and the E3 ubiquitin ligase, Parkin, initiating mitophagy for selectively removing damaged mitochondria [3]. To investigate PINK1 mutation impacts on PINK1-TOM complex formation, Blue Native Polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis (BN-PAGE) was done on stable cell lines in PINK1 knockout (KO) HeLa cells expressing doxycycline-induced PINK1/mutants. BN-PAGE substitutes SDS with Coomassie G250, preserving proteins in their native conformation, and utilizes non-ionic detergents for solubilization, ensuring complex integrity during analysis [4, 5]. Studying the PINK1-TOM complex has proved vital for our understanding of PINK1 stabilization on mitochondria. Here, we share our method for resolving protein complexes by blue native PAGE for PINK1-TOM complexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"56np7","text":"For making mitochondrial enriched fraction first harvest the cells after giving desired treatments (doxycycline for PINK1 induction and Antimycin/Oligomycin for mitochondrial damage). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8c5ke","text":"For collection keep plates with cells   covered with aluminium foil to provide even cool surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8717l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ku0a","text":"Wash the cells with PBS and collect the cells with cell scraper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lb64","text":"Collect the cells by centrifugation at   for   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91kph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"800","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ri6j","text":"Pellet down the cells at   for   at  . For 150 mm plate cell pellet, add   of mitochondria fractionation buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8kh7o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"800","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qc7c","text":"Disrupt cell membranes using a 25-gauge needle by passing through it for 25 times  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"87vss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2har","text":"Discard the cytoplasmic membrane/nucleus/debris pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2idvo","text":"Isolate supernatant and centrifuge at   for   at   to collect mitochondrial enriched fraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kcpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"17000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"513lo","text":"Try to remove as much buffer as possible from the pellets as it may interfere with the BN-PAGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"449bf","text":"Snap-freeze the mitochondrial enriched pellet for Blue native PAGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d270o","text":"Start with mitochondrial enriched pellets, snap-frozen and stored at  . A single freeze-thaw cycle has negligible effects on TOMs/PINK1. Whole cells can also be used but the signal is clearer in mitochondrial enriched fraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fc5bq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bbt6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2jiad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"832r","text":"Do not freeze-thaw more than once. The lower PINK1 band near 480 kDa is more susceptible to freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tfqb","text":"Prepare Native-PAGE sample buffer per sample as described in buffer section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1epn0","text":"Thaw mitochondrial pellets   and very gently resuspend them in BNPAGE buffer   with 1% digitonin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a43uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"913c2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eeka8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"2":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":152},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":158}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ei95","text":"If you suspect traces of buffer in mitochondrial pellet, first make 1X buffer without digitonin and gently resuspend the pellets. Centrifuge samples at   for   and proceed normally.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8djjr","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"centrifuge":"17000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"centrifuge"},"1":{"data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77cbd","text":"Store   and incubate for  , gently pipetting up and down 10-15 times every  . Digitonin is chosen after optimizing with different reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"952tv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al9qn","text":"Post-solubilization, centrifuge samples at   for   at  . Transfer the supernatant to a cold Eppendorf, noting a small red pellet of insoluble material. If desired, solubilize this material in 1X SDS-PAGE buffer for further analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dep8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"20000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1denl","text":"Quantify the lysate using BCA Protein Assay Kits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mkv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cvp1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7v9pl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a7idp","text":"Do not use Bradford protein assay reagent.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gt6t","text":"Make samples of concentration around 1-2 ug/ul, typically loading 15-20 μg of solubilized mitochondrial pellets for one lane of a BN-PAGE gel. For diluting the lysates, make up the samples using 1x BN-PAGE lysis buffer with 1% digitonin. It is important to maintain the detergent percentage constant for proper Coomassie G250 and digitonin raito.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eusq","text":"Prepare gels in 1X Native PAGE running buffer (20x stock, make up   in Millipore water). Also, prepare light and dark inner chamber buffers. Keep all buffers at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5ood","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9glgi","text":"Add Coomassie G250 additive to samples (at 1/4 the detergent concentration, i.e., 0.25% if using 1% digitonin). Pipette thoroughly to distribute Coomassie in the sample; the sample will turn a deep blue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vb2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc9vk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgljd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":42}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"de1b5","text":"Do not heat the samples. Keep the samples   the whole time.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1j1jf","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6krk","text":"Set up the gel apparatus in a cold room. Pour a small amount of Dark inner buffer into the inner chamber to check for leaks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9icd","text":"Remove any buffer from wells using an aspirator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44i86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c26r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3flk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"87cjh","text":"Optional: You can give a wash to wells by filling them with clear running buffer and aspirate them.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7r2f0","text":"Dry load samples onto the gel and use Native-Page ladder. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7n87","text":"After loading, fill the inner chamber with   Dark inner buffer and 1x running buffer in the outer chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"37m3i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co7uk","text":"Run the gel at 7mA constant current and allow the sample to enter the gel until it runs 1/3rd of the total gel. Subsequently, empty both inner and outer buffers, replacing the inner buffer with LIGHT buffer and filling the outer chamber with 1x running buffer again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5o0ev","text":"Continue running the gel at 7mA for 2-3 hours until the full gel is stained.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n473","text":"Prepare 1x NuPAGE transfer buffer (20x stock) in a quantity sufficient for one transfer tank. Set up the transfer tank as usual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tdco","text":"For BN-PAGE, opt for PVDF membranes, as nitrocellulose binds Coomassie irreversibly. Activate the PVDF membrane in 100% methanol for   before placing it over the gel in the transfer tank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lqmm","text":"Upon completion, place the transfer tank in an ice bucket filled with ice. Run   at ~60mA, limiting voltage to ~15 volts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8js9v","text":"Disassemble the transfer tank. If successful, most or all of the Coomassie staining on the gel will transfer to the PVDF membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddnc1","text":"Destain Coomassie with 100% methanol 2-3 times for   each. A slight Coomassie staining may persist (from the added samples; background staining will be removed).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ajp35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"240q4","text":"Restain the gel with Ponceau to visualize protein ladders. Mark ladders and scan the blot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e778n","text":"Wash Ponceau with TBST (0.1% tween) until fully destained (3 times for   each). It might take longer to destain completely. If needed, incubate in 5% milk in TBST to destain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4nt1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95g2u","text":"Block in fresh 5% milk for   (do not use BSA for blocking) and probe   as for a standard Western blot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9q21r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bl1l9","text":"Wash membranes three times in TBST for   each to remove residual primary antibody. The primary antibody may give different signals depending on how the antibody binding site is exposed in a complex. For visualization of PINK1 in PINK1-TOM complex, CST-PINK1 antibody works best.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fk6nq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"374gn","text":"Utilize HRP-conjugated secondary antibodies. Prepare HRP-conjugated AB (1:5000 in milk), incubate at   covered for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":101,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":115,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4jni7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87tj9","text":"Remove the secondary antibody and wash three times in TBST for   each and once in TBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9vcdh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"166jk","text":"Use ECL to visualize HRP-conjugated antibodies. Prepare the ECL reagent mix (1:1) just before scanning. Pour off TBS on one membrane and add   ECL mix; immediately scan, adjusting scanning times based on the primary antibody and protein abundance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":141,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2co6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
